i mean honestly that gap has kinda been getting bridged tbh
like a lot of the difficulty of avoidance comes from asking to be consistent for 5+ minutes
where the typical needle save is less than 1 minute
just manipulate the rng
but with stuff like Ascend and Hold Right, that gap has been closed
the hardest needle games are much more mechanically challenging than the hardest avoidance games
it's like asking what is harder, getting a winning lottery ticket or flipping heads on a coin 1000 times in a row
i guess what what im going for has some aspects of avoidance, platforming, and like momentum-based physics movement
I kind of finished a pvp physics board game but i havent dove into publishing bc its scary with online stuff (potential cost implications)
like the service i use for the multiplayer will charge me hella if people actually play the game LOL

so im now exploring a singple-player offline idea that I can learn steam publishing without the risk of extra 3rd party service agreements
